Description: Two fragments of papyrus written with black ink with demotic texts mounted on the two sides of the same frame. Larger fragment: legal text on recto (ends of 8 ll.), verso pasted down. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Sale of land or house (prob.). names of parties lost. Date. lost. reign of Ptol. Epiphanes(?). Origin. Gebelen(?)". Smaller fragment: vestiges of accounts.
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT (larger fragment only). Ed. in S. E. Thomas Cambridge PhD diss.Text 2 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (S.E. Thomas).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (638) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/638)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, loss, deposit, fractured Black ink (loss) Backed: white paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: paper (damaged) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Alan Henderson Gardiner
